meanings.sent1: She felt demeaned by the rude comments.
meanings.sent2: The demeaned cat walked with its head down.
meanings.sent3: The demeaned squirrel wore a tiny crown as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The old castle stood demeaned by time's relentless march.
meanings.sent5: The once proud ship now looked demeaned and forgotten in the harbor.

meanings.definition: To lower in character or quality
meanings.sent1: His actions demeaned his reputation in the community.
meanings.sent2: The poor quality of the product demeaned its value.
meanings.sent3: The comedian demeaned himself by telling bad jokes all night.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the monument demeaned its historical significance.
meanings.sent5: The careless behavior demeaned the hard work of the team.

meanings.sent1: The bully demeaned his classmates with hurtful words.
meanings.sent2: She felt demeaned when her ideas were dismissed without consideration.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick backfired and demeaned his own skills.
meanings.sent4: The scandalous article demeaned the reputation of the politician.
meanings.sent5: The defeat in the final game demeaned the team's efforts throughout the season.
